intro: Diascia alonsooides, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves and produces clusters of small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its compact growth habit and long blooming period make it an attractive addition to gardens.
